title: Short-Intensive Teacher Professional Development Program Based on Computational Thinking (CT)

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary computer literacy and teaching experience
context.additional_context: In-house corporate training programs for practicing professionals (medical/legal/technical)

learning_goals: Participants can accurately explain computational thinking (CT) concepts at over 80% accuracy using the curriculum-based professional learning (CBPL) approach.
Participants improve self-efficacy for designing plugged/unplugged CT activities by at least 70%.

Participants establish three strategies (e.g., collaboration platform adoption, digital resource sharing systems, cloud-based project management) to enhance CT education aligned with school culture (sharing/teamwork) and technical resources, then validate feasibility (â‰¥80% achievement) via a team checklist (5 items: goal clarity, resource availability, role distribution, scheduling, risk management) within one week.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
